status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson opened a new pull request, #14403:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14403

   In practice I believe that tests were off by default, but this at least switches us to an argument that is respected and removes the warning about unknown cmake args.

pitrou commented on PR #14403:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14403#issuecomment-1277804780

   I hope this also reduces build times? :-)

nealrichardson commented on PR #14403:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/14403#issuecomment-1278302525

   > How about adding `-DBUILD_TESTING=OFF` to common CMake arguments instead?
   
   Sounds good. If we do this, we should also delete the other `-DBUILD_TESTING=OFF` scattered about--there are 6 others in the thirdparty toolchain, and looks like `BUILD_TESTING` shows up in a few other places too.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: In https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/commit/a50ae369a30f99f79d7559002aba3413dac1bd48, the argument changed from {{ABSL_RUN_TESTS}} to {{BUILD_TESTING}}. A verbose thirdparty build now shows that ABSL_RUN_TESTS is being ignored. (BUILD_TESTING seems to be OFF by default, so it's probably not a big deal, but we can be explicit.)
